title: What are some black progressive rock artists? - Quora

response.answer_text: That’s a good question. Off the top of my head the only ones I can think of are Vernon Reid, Corey Glover, Will Calhoun and Doug Wimbish; collectively known as Living Colour. They’re more Funk Rock than Progressive Rock, but if you’ve ever really listened to their stuff it can get pretty complex at times. Odd time signatures and arpeggios and whatnot. So I’d throw them on the list. Doug Pinnick from King’s X fits the bill. Stanley Clarke and Lenny White possibly. Though they’re a bit more Jazz Fusion than overall Progressive Rock. There’s P. P. Arnold. She’s more of a soul singer but she has recorded and performed with Pink Floyd, George Harrison, Steve Howe and Peter Gabriel; who all fall into the Prog Rock category at times. She was in The Nice with Keith Emerson; who’s one of the founding fathers of Prog Rock. Narada Michael Walden is a bit more Funk and Soul, but he’s been known to get a bit Progressive at times; especially in his stint with Mahavishnu Orchestra. There’s Andre Carswell and Raoul Walton of Anyone’s Daughter; currently and previously: respectively. Johanne James of Threshold. They’re Pregressive Metal. That counts. That’s all i can muster at the moment.  Edit: Tosin Abasi. He founded Animals As Leaders; which is one of the dominant instrumental Progressive bands around. (Thanks to Ed Seith and Rick Carnahan for the comments.) Stevie Wonder. His stuff most definitely pushed the boundaries of the average funk and soul music of his day. I might consider him more Progressive Jazz/Funk than Rock; but the prog spirit is there so he’s on the list. (Thanks to Jeff Hillstead for the comment.)

Jimi Hendrix!!!!!! Also, if Elvis can be considered Rock & Roll, these guys can fall into the alternate category as well: Temtpations Sam Cooke Chuck Berry Ray Charles If you mean currently, I’m kind of stuck in the past and would say: Lenny Kravitz…but this is kind of old school. As far as new guys…..I have NO idea!!!
